title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
820-4924 no backlight.
liquid damage at q7701. shorted inside the board at PPVIN_SW_LCDBKLT_SW, so i dig out the short, now resistance is good at 0.4kohm
fuse is good 12.6v at both side
ppvout is 12.6v at pin 1 of lvds connector.
i have bklt_en_R 3.3v
I use known good must be working 2015 lcd.
I have tried replacing q7701 q7700
need some pointer at why the output doesnt boost. any help appreciated, thank you..

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message: Do you have continuity between D7710 and R7731?

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message: yes its connected. 0.1 ohm resistance, so good.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message: I found that LCDBKLT_FET_DRV_R doesnt have any voltage, is that normal ?

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
Just to confirm, do you get image, but no backlight?

Are you sure no more damage in the burnt area?
You may need to change LCD connector.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
Yep absolutely sure theres an apple logo there, i get usb activity too.
The liquid damage  i found is only that short i dig out.
Im a bit concern maybe theres some line didnt reach it destination maybe cut out by the traces i dig?
I will try to change lvds, even thought it looks good

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message: Check all traces continuity in the backlight circuitry.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
i have changed lvds connector, still same.
diode mode at lvds : 
1 : 0.400
2 : nc
3 : 0.464
4 : 0.464
5 : 0.525
6 : 0.640
7: 0.610
8: 0.510
9: 0.730 
10: 0.430

u7700 have continuity from their pin to their surrounding component.
scl and sda line from u7700 have continuity to lvds connector.
what voltages supposed to be on pin 1 of u7700 ? its cycling with 1.2v at peak.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
Pins 1/2 and 4 controls Q7701.
Be sure R7731-33 are all good, as their traces too.
Backlight level is adjusted through I2C bus; check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA pins.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
R7731-33 is good resistance all according to schematic.
Diode mode both scl and sda is same, so its good 0.451,
Any chance q7701 and q7700 kill each other? Should i replace at once ?
*update : q7701 and q7700 replaced at once still not boosting.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
scl sda voltage is 4.5v 4.6v
lcd_psr_en is 0v
edp_bkl_en is 3.3v

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message: how do you measure a coil ? L7710 resistance is 0.1 ohm, is that good ?

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
Check R7744/45; U7700 is correctlt powered up?
Just in case, replace D7710 and L7710.

BTW, a big coil is pure short in ohm scale as normal.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
r7744/45 is 0 ohm resistance , normal
u7700 is powered up 5v by vddd and vdda normally too.
d7710 and l7710 replaced. no backlight still.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message: Diode is good, because only O.L in one way right?

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
I suspect some broken trace.
Still 12V at pin 1/J8300?

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
Yeah still 12.3v at 1/j8300..
which component turn that ppbus voltage to 53v ?

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
53V, why???
Correct voltage is around 39V.
Higher volatge will mean no connection with LED strip.

I hope you've cheked all above with LCD connected.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
no.. i know 53v is without load, let me revise my question, what component turn that 12.3v to 39v ?
i have checked all my measurement with lcd connected.

title: 820-4924 no backlight boost.
message:
Backlight level is adjusted through I2C bus, is not just an enable signal required.
You must be sure to test with compatible (known good) screen.
PCH sends adjust signal (EDP_BKLT_PWM) to LCD and this one will resend adjust to U7700 via I2C bus.
